IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The mission is to provide affordable housing to individuals with disabilities.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To provide affordable housing to disabled individuals with developmental disabilities.
IRS990.Desc: To provide affordable housing to individuals with developmental disabilities.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Schedule J Part 1 Line 3 - The Board Operations committee which is made up of board members meet annually to evaluate the job performance of the CEO. Comparability data concerning compensation is assessed. A three year fixed compensation contract is established for the CEO by the Board Operations Committee. The three year annual CEO contract is approved by vote of the full Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990, Part VI, Section A Line 6 - The Board of Directors are members of the organization.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990, Part VI Section A Line 7a - The Board of Directors must be members of Evergreen Presbyterian Ministries, Inc. Any exceptions such as non-members must be approved by the Board of Directors of Evergreen Presbyterian Ministries.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990, Part VI Section A Line 7b - The Board of Directors must be members of Evergreen Presbyterian Ministries, Inc. Any exceptions such as non-members must be approved by the Board of Directors of Evergreen Presbyterian Ministries.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b - The 990 is prepared internally by staff and is reviewed by the Executive Vice-President - CFO. The 990 is then reviewed by the CEO and other senior management. Then the final draft of the completed return is provided to each board member via email. The board members are given the opportunity to review the 990 and pose any questions which are answered by the Executive Vice President-CFO before the final filing of the return.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c - Annually, each member of the Board of Directors is required to review and sign the conflict of interest policy. Any potential conflicts of interest are required to be disclosed at that time. The signed policies are retained in the corporate records. Officers and other employees are required by policy to request approval from the CEO if there are any relationships or activities that could give rise to potential conflicts.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15 - The Board Operations committee which is made up of board members meet annually to evaluate the job performance of the CEO. Comparability data concerning compensation is assessed. A three year fixed compensation contract is established for the CEO by the board operations committee. The three year annual CEO contract is approved by vote of the full Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19 - Documents are available to interested parties by request.
